description:
A good, reliable coffee shop that also serves delicious breakfast sandwiches! Fresh, toasted croissants and other breads are done just right. The sizes of the coffee drinks are LARGE! I got a medium and cant imagine how big the large ones are! 

The owner is very nice and accommodating. A great place to visit and watch the world go by here in the Haight.
author: Kim A.

description:
One of the things I miss most about living in the Haight - THIS COFFEE SHOP. Call my order in and BOOM - breakfast and coffee in less than 10 minutes, ready for pickup. At a good price too! Their made-to-order steamy hot bacon egg bagel sandwich and espresso has saved me from countless hangovers.

I will never find another coffee shop as perfect as you!
author: Yvette H.

description:
I gotta ask you comrades and brothers
How do you treat your own woman back home?
She got to be herself
So she can free herself
Singing coffee to the people 
Coffee to the people
Coffee to the people 
Coffee to the people, right on
Now, now, now, now...

This Haight-Ashbury makes me want to wear my love beads and smoke a doobie in honor of Jerry Garcia, and this casual coffeehouse fits right into the purple haze of this 'hood which has been overtaken by busloads of tourists. For some reason, they don't seem to make it in here, which is fine by me. I'm not into getting bad vibes from out-of-towners, man. I just like chillin' on one of the four fake-leather couches with my $2.40 Medium Coffee (photo: http://bit.ly/2P6rYJc) and chantin' my Buddhist meditation. Nam Myoho Renge Kyo. Peace out.

A million workers workin' for nuthin'
You better give 'em what they really own
We gotta put you down
When we come into town
Singing coffee to the people 
Coffee to the people 
Coffee to the people 
Coffee to the people, right on

COFFEE - 4 stars...smooth and groovy
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...just give me a couch and my peace medallion 
SERVICE - 3 stars...in their headspace, man
TOTAL - 4 stars...make coffee, not war

RELATED - Hanging out in the Haight? Here are the places I've tried and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2P8idKw
author: Ed U.

description:
This is the quintessential coffeehouse in the heart of Haight-Ashbury. I went here recently w/ a friend as we enjoyed herbal tea & conversation.

I enjoyed a mug of rooibos tea that was quite alright. Coffee to the People has heaps of political stickers decorated on the walls & tables.

There is a large bookshelf filled w/ communal books to read or board games to play such as scrabble or chess. Overall Coffee to the People is quite alright yet would love it if the seating was a bit more comfortable as the tables & chairs seemed a bit cramped.

It would be wonderful to have some low tables w/ floor seating on cushions. If that were to happen I would easily bump it up to 5 stars.

Still a solid place w/ good energy & the staff here were very kind.
author: Shane S.

description: Great affordable coffee in the Haight Ashbury District.  Love this place.  Quiet and clean with friendly staff.
author: Victor D.

description: Just your average local neighborhood coffee shop with really nice owners. The coffee is fine and I like the loose leaf tea. I just wish there was something about this place that would make it special aside from the wall of political stickers. I also wish they didn't make the world's worst bagel. They really skimp on the cream cheese and they burn them almost 75% of the time.
author: Jessica F.

description:
It's a nice, spacious cafe. Saw some board games so it'd be fun to go with friends. 

The cappuccino wasn't that great... I couldn't taste the coffee at all. My friend had ordered a coffee and said it wasn't bad but nothing special.
author: Sarah S.

description: Absolutely fantastic! Their hot chocolate was spot on if I do say so myself. Service was fast and I enjoyed the scenery very much! The cute sofas and book shelf's made me feel right at home! They have a lot of nice art pieces on the wall and the best part is if you like the art you can purchase it!
author: Lupe R.

description:
The coffee is not amazing but it's solid, certainly better than Starbucks but not as good as Blue Bottle.

The interior is pretty great.  They have lots of seating and it's laid out so that you feel like you're in a smaller, more private place.

It's also, critically, not all that busy.  You can go in, order, and find a seat without much hassle - much better than some place like Philz where you'd better come prepared to do battle if you want a seat.
author: Jason F.

description: I remember stopping here years ago. I thought the coffee was good but it was the atmosphere and setting in Height-Ashbury that I thought was amazing. For an outsider at the time, it was dream come true to be in such a wonderful setting where so much history had occurred in San Francisco!
author: Sam T.

description:
TL;DR I like strong coffee, and Coffee to the People has it.


We got an iced matcha latte and iced coffee. The iced coffee was super strong - I was impressed - and prices were reasonable.

The interior is cool, and there is plenty of seating. Definitely a place you can sit at for hours.

For those of you who coffee runs through like Usain Bolt (my friend and I are with you), the bathroom was clean, so no worries there.
author: Nic Z.

description:
It's a neighborhood coffee shoppe where people bump into people that they know.  I like the coffee they served here, it was dark roast, smooth, no acidity and robust!  Tastes so good especially when one has been drinking medium roasted coffee at home.  

Vibe is cool and lax.  The service was quick, friendly and with a big smile :)
author: Jenny T.

description: We initially just wanted to come in to go pee, but it was customers only, so we ordered a bagel and some coffee cake. Overall it was pretty good, and the price is relatively cheap compared to other coffee shop places. The seating was a little crowded though, it was a little uncomfortable being so close to others. Would pee there again.
author: Petrix S.

description:
Love this place. I always crash at my friends' house across the street after a long night of partying and I always love coming here for a breakfast sandwich to sort me out again. The croissant egg and cheese sandwiches are so delicious.

I love the coffee too. As a former barista, I can say that they make their lattes well. I always request an alternative milk and they have so many options here. I'm running an experiment to try them all: hemp, rice, coconut, almond, soy.

The staff is always so friendly, too! Such kind, bright people who work hard and efficiently. They're good at what they do and I've never been disappointed.

The atmosphere is calm, has good lighting, lots of seating, and generally has a good vibe and decor.

Only drawback I'd say is that it can get pricey. Everything is pretty reasonably priced but with upcharges for add-ons and substitutions it can rack up. But that's probably just me being picky about what I order.
author: Laura W.

description: Iced coffee tasted burnt and old. Had to add a lot of soy milk to make it good. Nice vibe and baristas though.
author: Brianna H.

description: Bland tasting, overpriced drinks. The owner is super cheap. He charges by the pump for syrups (like $1.50) and watches like a hawk to make sure his employees don't give any extra pumps for free. They are rude and the  service is terrible. Wish I never stepped foot in this place. Go to literally any coffee shop in The Haight before you ever come here. ZERO STARS!!!
author: Jack F.

description: Right in the heart of Haight. Such a great variety of coffee! Finally, a place where I don't know what to get because I'd never heard of half the things they offered! I loved being stunned and seeing new items as I drink coffee and check out new spots every day! I ordered the Flower Power with hemp milk and it was some of the best coffee I've had since I've been in SF. My friend agreed. The ham and cheese croissant was the perfect snack to hold us over until dinner. It was hot and pretty large actually. Totally hippie place. Hemp milk?!?! Yes please. The interior was comfortable and I would love to come back here to read sometime.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Delicious coffee with good options for breakfast. Large seating area to enjoy your sips.
author: Vtach A.

description:
Your average neighborhood coffee shop. It was pretty quiet, and I noticed a lot of people studying/working/reading. My friends and I came in to hide from the rain, but we ended up staying several hours to (quietly and respectfully) play some scrabble and warm up. I ended up ordering the Flower Power, which is essentially a dirty chai tea latte. Another friend got a chocolate mocha drink and it came with sprinkles! Very cute :) I wouldn't say they were anything extraordinary, but they were very appreciated and enjoyed fully. The coffee is also strong! If you need a pick-me-up, this is the place to go.

Note: If you need to use the restroom, you have to ask the staff to buzz you in.
author: Alice L.

description: This is a neighborhood cafe I looked into one day when I was looking for a place to settle in to for a few hours with something to drink and some space to sprawl out.  The menu and coffee selection here are well-rounded (I can't comment on the available roasts and coffee bean sourcing though), there is plenty of seating, and the wifi signal is strong, but it is so cold and poorly lit I had a hard time staying long enough to accomplish some of the things on my to-do list.  Otherwise, a small cup of coffee (slightly less than 8 oz I would guess) came out to $2 and there is also a credit card minimum of $5.  It's nice to know this cafe is here but it's not otherwise a place I would go out of my way to come back to.
author: Christine T.

description:
First time here and I'm already loving the ample space, variety in coffee, pastries and food! Such a nice, relaxing, comfortable vibe! I'll definitely be coming here more often to do some studying or getting some much needed personal reading time in. 

I got the flower power, not a big fan. I wish I would've stuck with a simple cappuccino but that's just a personal preference. I'm not a big fan of chai I've realized (which this drink has: Chai, Espresso, Vanilla Powder and Soy Milk) I'm glad I tried the drink though, it has great reviews just wasn't my cup of tea....or coffee, I should say.  

The poppyseed almond muffin was good. I'd recommend it. Plus, you can ask for it warmed up! 

Overall, glad I tried this place out, will be coming more often!
author: Denise D.

description: The place had a homie vibe and the people were nice but the vegan carrot cake that I got was way to dry, I had to pour some tea over it.
author: Dasha S.

description: I stop here every time I come to Haight Street. I look forward to my large #2-chocolate to the people. Simply delicious, kind of like a tuxedo from Starbucks but this place makes it better.
author: Evelia A.

description: The people who work here are some of the kindest humans I've ever met. They are so hard working, very fast, and always have a smile on their faces. I love the ambience of the cafe, too. It's very laid-back with plenty of books to read and games to play. There are regulars who spend their whole days there. I also love the music!
author: Tristan E.

description:
This was some of the worst espresso I have ever had, and I have worked in coffee shops for many many years so I feel that I have a good taste for good espresso. Also, the man who made my drink and took my order was rude and not very helpful when I wanted to make my drink more satisfying. 

However, I do like the ambiance inside. There are comfy couches to sit and read the myriad of books they provide.
author: Sarah M.

description:
This is my favorite cafe in San Francisco. 

There is a couple who opens every morning; I assume they own the place. The service is fast and friendly. I really enjoy interacting with them.

The space itself has a nostalgic feeling. It may be the social activist stickers from the 70s onwards layered on the tables and walls. It may be the Fleetwood Mac. It's a subtle but pervasive feeling, not distracting for when I need to work, but compelling when I just want to sit and think. 

If you want to see the Haight hippie kids, you can find them on the couches here, charging their smart phones.

Oh, I should probably say something about the food. I like their bagels.
author: Sherwood C.

description: Really fun place. Owners are so nice and they have great Madelines and smoothies. Stopped in from out of town looking for a little coffee shop and they were great! They were decently priced as well. Try the blueberry and strawberry smoothies.
author: Amber T.

description:
My flatmate and I went on a day trip to San Fransisco; Height and Ashbury was one of our stops, and she wanted to introduce me to this little coffee shop, and I wasn't in anyway disappointing!

First off, the people that work here are very friendly.They let me take my time in choosing what I wanted to drink, which was really nice. Seating wasn't hard to find, although the place is small, there was still seating available. Our coffees were ready rather quickly, which was also nice. The coffee itself tasted very good! The price for what we got was also very nice. 

Overall; A short, yet sweet review on a place that was quick to serve and had good quality coffee.
author: Bruce's A.

description:
I can only base this review off of the one coffee I got, but I actually really liked it! Soy cappuccino was one to remember.

Lots of space inside too - good for working or chatting.
author: Kelly G.

description: Comfy space, friendly staff, nice vibe. And a very skillfully made, delicious cappuccino. It's all good.
author: michelle g.

description: Great little coffee shop. The coffee was excellent. Tons of outlets to use a notebook or charge your phone. Plenty of seating and so clean.
author: John D.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for a while but rarely come to the Haight. And they live up to all their Yelp reviews  super friendly,fast service and great quality food and coffee! I def recommend the bagel veggie special!
author: Mandy F.

description: Worst place ever!!! I ordered a match tea latte paid 5$ and it was milk with color. I wanted to get a refund and they refused to give me my money back. I even talked to the manager and he was completely rude and unprofessional. Don't go to this place!!
author: Carolin P.

description: Classic San Francisco coffee shop, with quite stereotypical Height decoration. Good coffee, pastries and food, and comfortable couches.
author: Marta F.

description: its okay its pretty hippie enough for me kinda worn down junky type of cafe. i ordered a smoothie and it was no jamba juice but tasted pretty good. i havent tried the coffee but the place is alright i would come in here to kill time and get something to sip on
author: Abigail S.

description: Love this place. Mellow staff, and customers. Easily accessible internet, great music selection, and totally unpretentious.
author: Alexander R.

description:
Coffee to the People is great in theory. I'm guilty of mentally overlooking it when I need a place to work away from home but whenever a friend chooses this place as our meet-up spot, I'm reminded of how roomy it is, and often overlooked by *other* people, making it a good place to sort of spread out.

Their drinks are so-so, unmemorable drip coffee and pretty good speciality drinks (tea lattes and such). They have some halfway decent pastries and bites. It's definitely not BAD-bad.

Typically I'd give the joint 3 stars, but I gotta say, my encounter here the other day leaves a really bad taste in my mouth.

I was a watching a friend's kid a few days ago, in the early afternoon, and Coffee to the People was the decided place to drop him back off. So when I walked in with the kid and looked around for his dad, imagine my surprise when a presumably homeless person began screaming obscenities at us. "Fuxking pedophile! Get that kid away from me! Don't touch me, get this fuxking pedophile away from me! I don't want none of that sick little kid sh*t" and so on and so forth, she screamed. The kid I was with was obviously shaken, so I lead him away immediately to console him and tell him that that lady "was just having a bad day" etc. A few other patrons of course took notice, and added that she was cuckoo, crazy, and not to pay her any mind to help make the kid feel a bit more at ease.

Now, I live close to this neighborhood and am well aware of the mental instability that comes along with the terrain, having witness it firsthand many times. But when the woman who had been screaming at us proceeded to add cream and sugar to her coffee, while angrily muttering to herself and dragging her suitcase along clunkily within the establishment, and the staff said absolutely NOTHING to her, I was shocked.

I've worked in a coffee shop in a part of town that gets a lot of homeless folks, and I've given away a lot of free coffee to people who obviously couldn't afford it but were respectful when walking in. I've also escorted many people out who were being rude or vicious or getting in the face of customers. The fact that the staff did nothing, didn't ask her to leave or check with us to see if we were okay, is pretty inexcusable. Like, I get that Coffee to the People is in the Haight-Ashbury, that there are plenty of people shouting profanities and impeding on personal space all the time, but if you allow that sort of behavior in your business, what is separating your coffee shop from the street outside?

I don't know, if I was forgetting about this place before, now my overlooking it will be much more intentional.
author: Megan D.

description: The employees were very nice but their blended ice latte and carrot cake not so much. The carrot cake was really bland and so, so, so dry. They kindly warmed it up for me, but I have to say end of the day it was pretty rough and meh. As for the blended ice latte I would probably compare it to blended a**hole. I knew that it wouldn't be sweet as that is what I requested but it didn't even taste remotely anything like coffee. Pretty much just had the flavor profile of a turd. It did mask the carrot cake well though. End of the day it was a sad waste of 8 dollars.
author: Valerie G.

description:
I had a lot of work to do and I wanted a change of scenery so my boyfriend and I took a trip out to a cafe to study. 

I ordered a mint matcha mocha w/ almond milk substitute and a coffee cake on the side. My boyfriend got a mango strawberry smoothie. 

The mint matcha mocha is interesting. Pretty good but tasted more like matcha chocolate with a fair amount of mint and a hint of espresso. Interesting but not sure if I would get it again. Did not regret getting it though. 

The smoothie was fruit and pretty good. Like a slightly watered down jamba juice. 

The cake was the favorite. So buttery and tasted awesome with cinnamony sugary goodness. Tons if cinnamon sugar nut mixture crusted the entire outer slice and it was great. Awesome with my drink. 

Pretty chill study spot but smells slightly of hobo and the bathroom is really annoying.
author: Sofia R.

description:
I got a drink called "flower power" which combined espresso, almond milk (or perhaps soy?) & chai. I thought the combo was kinda neat.

Overall, the place was pretty dirty though (I even used their bathroom, so I know!).

I guess I like the concept of the place but my beverage was of just decent quality and the atmosphere wasn't very inviting, so I give it a 2!
author: Grace M.

description: Here on vacation and honestly this place is really good. The Chocolate To The People iced coffee is delish and there breakfast bagel is amazingly good! The egg is so fluffy and not dry nor to wet. Just perfect  I totally recommend this place if your around the area
author: Diana M.

description:
Veggie special with bacon, iced flower power, SF origins on the tables and walls, and great company...

I'll say, what a wonderful life.
author: Dan Z.

description:
This placed reeked of bleach, that's why they so clean. But really, I don't like mixing my drank with overpowering smells. Hence, the 2 stars off from perfect.

The well-deserved 3 stars came from their very nice service and help. I ordered a dirty green tea latte and it had a lot of foam. I usually never ask anyone to remake a drink, but I nicely requested if I could change my order. They were so nice and helped me out with a vanilla latte. I'll give them all the credit they deserve! My latte came out how I liked it and I hope they do well! 

Off to new coffee adventures!
author: Bern M.

description:
Cute coffee shop. Free wifi and a nice relaxing environment to hang, catch up on your emails and charge your phone while you charge your energy with some great brews and healthy snacks. This would totally be my Central Perk hangout if I lived around here. 
Coffee was amazing & I did love the Aussie cereal bites.
author: Justin W.

description: Although I end up in the trendy over priced artisanal coffee shops around SF somewhat frequently, Coffee to the People is a refreshing laid-back alternative. It's cozy and embodies the haight street culture. It's inclusive and has character. The bagels are delicious, the coffee is strong and they have a number of different signature drinks and every milk alternative you can imagine. If you're in the area, this is a comfortable place to work, grab a simple breakfast or a good coffee.
author: Jhana C.

description:
I feel like I have been searching around America for a good coffee, that isn't burnt or over foamed and finally I found it! 
This place is adorable, designed in an artsy vs thrifty design. If you want a good coffee in a chilled atmosphere come here!!
author: Tina P.

description: Nice, casual cafe. Good for studying but also has a lot of food options for breakfast and lunch. When I went, the wifi was not connecting for some reason.
author: Juliana P.

description:
I went there last night, and had to explain how to make a macchiato. just a standard macchiato. please note: they have this on their menu. I double checked. 

Today, I waited 15 mins for one of the worst lattes of my life. It would have better to drink old milk and dirt....or maybe that's what it was. I'm not sure.
author: Max P.

description:
My bf got the Mint Matcha Mocha here and it was amazing! So much matcha flavor in this! I didn't really taste the mint as much so maybe the matcha was overpowering it but I didn't mind. The drink is not too sweet or too bitter. Would definitely get it again! 

The atmosphere of the cafe is also pretty cool. There's lots of interesting artwork on the walls, some couches for people to sit on, some books on the shelves, and lots of tables. There were also some interesting pastries and food on the display. My friends ordered some sandwiches and said they were pretty good. This is probably a great place to catch up with friends, do some studying, or have a casual date!
author: Sandra N.

description: This place was absolutely amazing, I just ran in for a cup of coffee and was blown away.  I ordered the golden gate specialty drink which was an orange and dark chocolate coffee beverage, and I can't stop thinking about it I may have to come back to Haight Ashbury just to have it again before we leave!!!!
author: Lexi F.

description:
I love it when the workers are so nice.

On that note, I order my peach energy drink which has red bull and syrup, the total comes out to 4.18 and their minimum is $5 for card. As I say "oh since, your guys' minimum is 5 lemme get..." and this kind worker goes "it's okay, don't worry about it! I read your mind" hahaha how cute! So I tipped her because she was so kind. 

Whenever I need to come study, not from my apartment, I'll probably come here cuz it's affordable, perfect to do work at and just chill!
author: Thai C.

description: Been here a couple times when I'm visiting the city. Great tasting coffee and they actually have savory-type snacks. Came here with the BF and got lasagna and hot chocolate on Halloween as we waited for our Haunted Haight tour to commence. I want to return again next time.
author: Jill D.

description: Super consistent great service! The employees are welcoming and friendly, and the drinks are almost always served within the minute (including cappuccinos!) Fastest and warmest service I've experienced at a coffee shop in SF. Bonus points for high quality drinks, drink accommodations (soy, almond, and hemp milk options, and a clean atmosphere. The shop also has a reading section complete with bookshelves and a small game shelf which holds board games and some children's toys.
author: Isabel T.

description:
Underwhelming. :( I am by no means a coffee connoisseur. In fact, I'm not a coffee drinker at all! I ordered hot chocolate and what I got was water with one of those instant packets mixed in?? And it sure wasn't a quality packet either! I drank watered down chocolate-water with whipped cream on top. *wipes away tears* 

My friend ordered a coffee, but I haven't seen anyone really raving about the coffee here. The service was alright, nothing special. I guess it's a spot where you can sit down and study? There were many people plugged into their laptops or reading books.

This place seems to solely rely on its space and location. But it makes me sad because it has so much potential to be great! The location is wonderful. The service could be upped a notch, the drinks *could* be really well made and they could have lines going out the door. ;( +1 star for what it could be.
author: Ani R.

description: The coffee here was great and the atmosphere was wonderful. Yes we are tourists and yes we were looking for the hippie vibe and are therefore happy to fall into the tourist traps but this didn't feel like that. A great cafe serving great coffee in in one of the great places on this planet. If I was a local this would be my local.
author: Barry D.

description: Nothing out of the ordinary, i got a vanilla latte and it came out quick. MaybeI'll try next time
author: Kaycee-zhanel C.

description:
Cozy hipster environment with decent coffee in the Haight District. 

While it's not my typical place to sit down for a cup of joe it was nice to get out of the rain and support a small privately owned business in the area rather than dish our your hard earned bucks to the big guys. 


Going back? Probably not, it just wasn't for me. I'm sure others would or do enjoy this place frequently.
author: Brian A.

description:
So friendly! They have very good special/signature drinks - I tried Flower Power (dirty chai with vanilla) and I loved it!

The couches in the back are comfortable and there's some interesting old books to browse (babysitters club to various travel guides)
author: Kristin W.

description:
3 - 3.5 stars

If you're familiar with the Haight, you'll know the location - just across the street from the Medusa mural. Walking inside, there's a sofa-lounge area on the right, with a small library of books. Nice place to chill if you've a good book or just wanna grab one off the shelf.

Coffee is decent, I've only had the soy lattes (no almond milk). Haven't yet tried any of the food or pastries.

There often seems to be a wait for the solitary bathroom. And, if you're the outdoor patio type, you won't find one here.

But hey, it's just coffee. If things don't go well for you here, you're only out a few bucks...plus, it's less than two blocks to walk your dog at Buena Vista Park!
author: John H.

description: "The cycle of complacency is a human flaw..." --Me. But there is no complacency when it comes to great quality food and services... ¡The blueberry crumb cake is to dye4! However, the $1.25 price cost for a regular coffee refill is to much, it should be $.75 of which is reasonable y fare...
author: G. G.

description: Best staff out of any coffee shop I've ever been to.  Coffee is very good and comes out quick.  Be ready!  Also has a great neighborly vibe inside with lots of characters and friendly people.
author: Drew B.

description:
I am addicted to this place and go there once or twice a week! The owners are awesome and very friendly, know their regular customers and their drink preferences. I recommend the "Chocolate to the People" and their bagel sandwiches.

I often just take a coffee to go, but it's clearly a place people like to meet at, study, work, etc. Whenever I have to meet someone in the area, that's where I send them.
author: Ost B.

description:
My pals and I planned an awesome trip to the Monterey Bay Aquarium for the day and needed some light snacks for the road. Conveniently, he lived right next to a hip little coffee shop that served up some yummy looking baked goods which were perfect for the trip.

I shared a slice of the poppyseed loaf with my girlfriend and we were fortunate to get an end piece that usually has the best mix of textures. Unfortunately it was a little bit burnt which wasn't so good but otherwise the center was fluffy and flavorful.

Service was friendly and it looked like a good place to work out of, albeit a little dirty. There tends to be several homeless people right outside the door which contributes to the authenticity o the area, but not something you necessarily want from a coffee shop. Overall, it's a good place to drop in for a drink but Starbucks is more up to date on their amenities.

Food: 6/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Pro Tip: Parking in Haight-Ashbury is pretty terrible. Be like me and park 6 blocks south will definitely cut down the frustration of circling constantly and not finding anything.

Came here on a perfect Sunday afternoon. Weather was amazing and everyone was outside so the neighborhood was absolutely packed.  

This coffee shop is really spacious with plentiful seating at tables and also a sofa area with books. It was fairly empty when I visited and would make a great place to study or have a first date at. 

Service was great with a friendly and helpful staff. I ordered a hot caramel macchiato which I thought tasted better than Starbucks. Would absolutely come here again if I find myself in the area.
author: Eric B.

description:
cool name! coffee had to be great right? WRONG.

walking in it had a very cool vibe and looked very promising.

the people were nice and helped my gf choose a drink a mocha!

when they served the drink the lady put it on the counter and forgot to mention that the cup was 234235325 degrees and my gf burnt her hand.

once we started drinking the BITTER BITTER coffee we came to realize it was burn!

weak! cool name, cool vibe, burnt coffee WACK
author: Jaime D.

description: The staff had great service and equally great coffee. It's an urban atmosphere with a wall of political stickers that reflect the surrounding culture in the area. I've been here for early morning coffee with the family twice and it's definitely worth the short walk to get quality coffee. There are several cozy couches to lounge on towards the back of the coffee shop that look like the perfect area for a study session if you happen to be a student wanting to get away from the noise of the street.
author: Joshua W.

description: What a gem!  This is a very chill and relaxed environment with unique artwork on the wall, organic coffee, tons of drink options, and lots of seating.  I think there was some food available too, but I didn't notice what--- I had my eyes on coffee.  Coffee to the People reminds me of one of my favorite coffee shops in my hometown; so I felt right at home.
author: Heather E.

description: Just off the beaten Haight Street path is strong coffee & the softest blueberry muffins I've ever tasted! Service is quick and friendly. Large open seating area including tables & couches. Generally the doors are propped open to let the daylight in. Be aware of the $5 minimum to use a credit card prior to arrival.
author: William W.

description: Good drinks, pleasant atmosphere, great layout and decent free wifi.
author: Scott B.

description:
Ode to coffee and odious Haight bummy peeples.. This is a great spot to pop in to dodge the human feces left on the sidewalk from the bum crack parties of the night prior..

There is a menu of breakfast items and coffee for the peeps.. I really enjoyed my cafe au lait and the egg sandwich..What I enjoyed even more about this spot, was the laid back living room style set up.. Good book, comfy chair, cup a jo and what more do ya need?
author: Sara F.

description: If you love being in a peaceful and warm environment, then this is the place for you. Best damn cup of coffee I've ever had, and their breakfast bagels are the BOM. Also, the staff are so nice. Definitely my new local spot in the Haight.
author: Jasenia Q.

description:
As the afternoon approached I felt the need for a nice warm beverage. As I was on the haughty already I went to coffee to the people.

Since I'm not a big caffeine freak I had a hot chocolate. As soon as I had my first sip I was amazed that the warm fluffy liquid didn't scorch my tongue like Starbucks normally does.

The hot chocolate itself was very light and creamy. It didn't feel watered down at all. 

The scenery in the restaurant is very nice. On the right there is a set of couches with a book case so you can read while sipping on your warm beverage (or cold whatever you like). In the front there are plenty of tables so you can sit even if the place is stuffed(which it isn't really at all). 

If you feel tired or just in need of some good beverages go to coffee to the people.
author: Martin K.

description: Comfortable and ample seating.  The barista was very helpful when i probably annoyingly didn't know what I wanted.  Great coffee and they have a nice selection of vegan food options.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I don't prefer this coffee place, and I'm sure there's much better ones around, but this was too convenient and I WANTED COFFEE SO BADLY.  I do like the fact that you can add your own simple syrups for free, along with a nice collection of cinnamon, nutmeg, and other powders to sweeten/ spice up your order.  (I even spice white mochas lol).  

Prices aren't cheap, but I ordered a plain latte instead of paying for one of their flavors.  I couldn't taste much of the coffee....I wanted to taste the espresso!!!  The latte was a litte over ($3) after tax.  For a PLAIN latte.

Very spacious, however.  Plenty of seating.  The bathroom IS gross.  And the barista must "buzz" you in.  No mirror in the bathroom.  You can forget your makeup touchups lol unless you brought your own mirror and don't mind holding your purse and everything with you in order to not put ANYTHING on the dirty floor.
author: Christina G.

description:
I really enjoyed this coffee spot :) I went on a Saturday, and it wasn't crowded. There's plenty of seating--even couches toward the back. 

I ordered the iced mint matcha mocha and I believe it was the lox special. The lox special was good, but what I really liked was the iced mint matcha mocha. It was really refreshing!  ~craving it now...mmmm~

The ambience was so chill. They even had a few games to choose from. Being huge Friends fans, my cousins and I HAD to pick up the Friends trivia game! 

Overall, this place was pretty cool and would come back to try more of their drinks... Or I'll just stick to the mint matcha mocha :P
author: Geraldine B.

description:
This was my original destination on Friday afternoon, but I went to the wrong cafe by accident. Feeling a little defeated, I decided to make a second coffee pit stop at Coffee to the People. One more coffee never hurt, right? 

There were two cashiers. One was completely stumped when I asked her which desserts were vegan. "Vegan?" she asked, perplexed, confused, dumbfounded even. After a moment, she directed me towards the savory side of the glass case, which did contain one vegan option and two non-vegan ones. 

I quickly spotted a vegan carrot loaf on the sweet side and decided to go for that. It was very reasonably priced (only $2.50, awesome!). The cake part was a little too dry, but the frosting was stellar.

I ordered an almond milk latte from a second cashier, who appeared to also have barista duties. She was exceptionally friendly and made small talk, and I felt much more at ease with her. 

They have several non-dairy milk options: soy, rice, almond, and hemp. My almond milk latte was pretty tasty, although a touch too foamy. I'll order it extra wet next time. 

I would definitely return if I find myself in the Haight again. I don't make it out there too often, but I should make an effort to.
author: Brandi W.

description:
Uhmmmmm?  What happened to my old friends behind the counter?  Hadn't been to this old haunt in over a year and apparently ownership has changed.  Coffee still good but the old vibe is GONE.  Also, the guy behind the counter is quite stinky (seriously take a bath).  His heady aroma fills the entire establishment and I'm still catching whiffs sitting by the open front door.

Miss the old management and "hippiness" of before but coffee is still good, I suppose
author: Ngeean x.

description: All the drinks taste watered down and are just bad quality, also refused to refund me my money. I do not recommend.
author: Ericka T.

description: A cozy little coffee shop in Haight-Ashbury. Very casual. Lots of couches. Books. Laptops. Reminded me of home. (Chicago.) I ordered the Mint Matcha Mocha and couldn't have been more pleased. I've never had a specialty drink combine the three and was scared at first, but super intrigued. I'd would definitely order it again!! The girl at the counter was sweet and the service was quick. Wish they could deliver to me 2,200 miles away.
author: Heather J.

description:
This was a great place to grab an early morning breakfast for me and a couple friends. The coffee was great and the breakfast was great for a quick go. 

The service was a little dull and unfriendly, but they were very accommodating with my order.  

My favorite part of waiting for my coffee was reading the bumper sticker wall. Check it out if you're there.
author: Matthew R.

description:
The coffee was okay, the cookies were stale and disgusting. 

But the coffee shop is super cute and comfortable and just a great place to hang out.  I would go back just to hang out, not for the food.
author: Jenn T.

description:
I've frolicked up and down the Haight a few times since moving here, tried a few coffee spots and was a bit disappointed until I came across this spot. I was so impressed as I took my first sip of coffee! YUM and thank you for supplying me with caffeine right in the nick of time! I was craving some good coffee all day and being previously disappointed by other spots in the area, you seemed to be my last resort and you turned out to be amazing..thank you!

This coffee spot has tons of seating and tables, ranging from wooden chairs to several couches. Love couches in coffee shops! The staff was very friendly, made my iced coffee well, tasted great, and the prices are appropriate. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in the area!
author: Akvile D.

description:
There is so much going on here that I must state, there are def both pros and cons to this place - a give and take. I am not from the area so keep in mind...

The pros: The reason I came here was because of the wifi and outlets availability. I also love open spaces and this place has this with much seating, including a handicapped table as well as s few couches/sofas. The selection of drinks and pastries are in good variety. You're surrounded by fun shops also. If you must migrate, there are other cafe's nearby as well. Fair-trade certified. The service is quick. It is a good place to meet up with people when not trying to impress. They also seem to support local arts and crafts which is noble, yes?

The cons: There is a waft of BO that you will smell here and there, as others have mentioned - welcome to Haight-Ashbury. It might be worse in the summertime? It does not look as grungy as it may sound here. The baked goods do not look the most appetizing, although the concept sounds delightful (ie: Vegan tamale pie). Most important when talking about a coffee shop, the coffee is not good. Perhaps, is it my own subjective opinion, and you may love it. To me, the drip does not taste fresh and tastes like a Denny's cup of joe. I will drink really any coffee though, but the coffee or the cup I got it in smells like rubber. I have no explanation for any of this.

Neutral: The music is pop-ish....something that keeps me awake when doing desk work or driving. However, it may be disappointing when you expect a certain type of coffee "culture" walking in.
author: E K.

description: My favourite coffee shop in SF. Relaxed vibe and they let you take your time lounging on their comfy couches while sipping your latte.
author: Morgen S.

description: Delicious coffee, great environment. The place is gorgeous and I can't wait to come back
author: Greg S.

description: This is my favorite coffee shop in the Haight. It's not super hipster cool and probably doesn't have the best lattes, but it is cozy, unpretentious, spacious, the service is fast, and the wifi works well.
author: Lori L.

description: They don't have a large variety of food though. Good place if you want to sit down and get some coffee and tea! I usually come here to grab some lunch if I'm in a rush because they're quick with their orders, their sandwiches are pretty fresh.
author: Sherry F.

description:
For someone who was looking for a place to work, this place is great. Free wifi (although because of the amount of people who use it, it's crap), lots of power points, and lots of tables. And the coffee is still good. 

But although Coffee to the People might be bringing coffee to people, they sure don't do it with a smile. Bad service is a bit of an understatement and it seems like the new owners expect everyone who walks in to want to rip them off. They even have one of those machines that checks the authenticity of a bill, and used it on my $20 bill. I giggled and then got a death stare from the man behind the counter. 

And if you're not a patron here, don't even THINK about using the bathroom. It doesn't matter if your jumping from one foot to the other, promising to buy something the moment you come out. Bathrooms are for paying guests only.
author: Mariko F.

description:
This is a great coffee shop! My twin sister & I went in there once, and tripped with the barista. It was one of those days we said everything in unison, ordered the same thing & had inadvertently put on the same outfit. We were apparently the "twinniest twins" she'd ever met. Deliiiightful. 

The coffee is damn good! Art, encouragement to both reflect & evolve, and respect for the 60s all make this a 5 star establishment, for me.
author: Em L.

description: Coffee just meh. Interesting decor though! Definitely an apropo place to get coffee on Haight.
author: Daniel K.

description: I was visiting San Francisco this month and was just strolling in the Haight neighborhood and dropped in here for lunch. I ordered a turkey club which was a decent sandwich that I split with my Mother. The five star rating is because this was simply the BEST coffee I have ever had! And coming from a coffee snob, which I am not ashamed of by any means, this is quite the compliment. Great vibe in this shop too, felt like I would just enjoy sitting and sipping for hours...highly recommended
author: Spy G.

description: I love the location of this precious place and I stop here whenever I'm in the Haight. My hemp latte is delicious, and I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a good drink, table space, and free wifi in the Haight.
author: Tatiana F.

description:
I love this place. They are so nice and know my order :)

I get the hot chocolate which is really tasty, but I have to get it extra hot because their regular is just not that hot.

I love their chocolate croissants and their bagel sandwiches and their yogurt parfaits. The smoothies are so-so. I've also gotten a turkey sandwich for lunch later in the day and it was SO GOOD! Kept well for hours too.
author: Alexandra W.

description: Every time I go to SF I end up here at some point. The coffees and treats are good. The iced mocha was a little watery, but the quadruple shot cappuccino was delicious! I enjoy the funky hippy atmosphere here.
author: Louise R.

description:
The staff here are crazy friendly.

Breakfast burrito was surprisingly good, despite the instant eggs.

Moderate hobo/hassle factor on the street outside.

 Parking options are decent.
author: Boner J.

description: I like everything about this place except the fact that many bums are always standing at the door and asking for money. In my opinion Coffee to the People it's quite better than other coffee shops in in the height. One of the reasons why I like this shop is because they have large and comfortable couches were I can sit for hours while I enjoy my coffee. They do not have a varied menu to choose among when I want to have something sweet (they should have cakes, Tiramisu, etc) but their lunch selection is wide and inexpensive, a lasagna costs only $5 and other meals value is quite similar to this one. I do not think I can get anything better.
author: Danny G.

description:
must have given myself away this weekend as "the scrabble guy" from the yelp review.  Thanks to the guys at C2TP for recognizing that.

also, thanks for the extra J's for the MOJO on a triple word score.  (still didn't stop me from getting my butt handed to me in that game, but at least I cracked 400).
author: Mike V.

description: Cool spot - Haight & Masonic - to get a cup of joe, with a little left leaning politics along with. Hmmm, it's Haight. Make that unabashed liberal politics. That aside, reasonably priced coffee & eats, music, & good wireless. A good live music dive just down the block. And a community library to boot - give one, borrow one. Can still feel the love. Peace.
author: Glenwood J.

description:
I came here to get coffee and be productive. It didn't disappoint!

There are tons of chairs/tables and 4-6 couches too. The couches have skylights above them and are in the back by the counter. I didn't sit there but it means that the space is well lit throughout, which makes for a nice working environment. 

I'll be coming back to get some work done!
author: Joel A.

description:
Coffee to the People is my go-to place for those rare but dreadful weekends when we are completely out of coffee beans and a frappe just won't cut it. 

The service is pretty fast and friendly, the coffee is ok and the pastries are so-so. I always either get a latte (hot or iced) and therefore cannot attest to their other beverage options. As for the breakfast food, the croissants aren't as fresh as I'd like but the muffins aren't half-bad. 

As for the decor and vibe, it's definitely comfy-looking and laidback; quiet enough to work, read or study. The crowd that frequents the place on weekends is really just people going in for their morning coffee. I've never seen anyone homeless or sketchy in there but given it's location, I'm sure it's not the most pleasant place to hang out in on weekday mid-mornings and afternoons.
author: Elsa K.

description: Got a basic cafe late and I enjoyed it. I like the atmosphere of this place, like the interesting library and all the hipster stickers. My friend liked this place too. It's also in a great location near Haight & Ashbury.
author: Alli R.

description:
The coffee and most of the pastries in here are OK but nothing I'd particularly stop for. A valiant effort certainly... The vibe is pretty fun though - the place looks like it's been the same since the 60s which adds to it's charm. 

If you need a place to sit after a bit of an adventure around Haight, or you're doing work, totally not a bad place to stop and grab a cup of coffee. Just don't expect the things you consume to be particularly mind blowing..
author: Tara K.

description:
Great place to study! It's got natural light, good deserts and coffee and a lovely atmosphere. Big comfy couches and free wifi! 
The staff is generally friendly and the prices are suitable for what you get.  
However, be warned that there are hippies and travelers that come in and out frequently. I didn't mind this at all, but some people may be skeptical.
author: Laura D.

description: Besides the homeless guys sleeping inside of the building, the coffee wasn't that great. I had a mocha, and a muffin. The muffin was ok (for Costco) but the coffee had zero flavor, like they put a small amount of chocolate milk. We might try one more time, but probably not.
author: Paul S.

description:
I love that they brew iced mate tea fresh when you order it! It's really strong and really good.

And I love all the cool art they put up. I asked one of the baristas about it and they said they feature different artists every two or three weeks. Way cool.
author: Heather J.

description:
A simply wonderful cafe in the heart of 1 of the hippest district of Frisco.  

This cafe has ample sitting, free wifi, delicious coffee, sandwiches, pastries & other delectables.  There are outlets throughout the place so enough free juice to power the people's very pricey Apple products.  Seriously, there is like a MacBook on every table.  Bill Gates & Co. must be jealous as hell every time they set foot into a cafe in this city & I suspect throughout the developed world.  lol

I like the decor & wall posters.  The message convey is that of solidarity with the common folk but based on the amount of traffic coming through this place, I suspect the owner(s) isn't struggling to put food on their dinner table.  Okay, that was a bit presumptuous on my part, but what the hell, it's my review I can say what I want...
author: Michael L.

description:
My heart hurts. I decided to take a melancholy stroll around the Haight to see if hippie-touristy-eclectic stuff could take my mind off things. Overpriced Bob Marley tie-dyes? No... Recycled 80s concert tees? No... (stupid boy, get out of my head!)... vintage fur coats... nope, still sadface Janna... pinup lingerie... gah. NOT HELPING. 

I dropped in on Coffee to the People on the way out of the neighborhood. I ordered an iced coffee and a vegan chocolate chip cookie. I walked out, took a sip of the coffee, and promptly forgot about everything else on earth. Holy moly. That shit packs a punch you wouldn't believe. In a really good way, if you like strong coffee - it had the kind of flavor that left me expecting a mouthful of coffee grounds as a chaser (fortunately this wasn't the case). An added benefit is that it obliterated the cardboard-esque flavor of the cookie, which I had tasted first.

The moral of the story is: if you need a pick-me-up, this is your place! Sadly, it's only temporary... now I'm listening to Céline Dion on repeat. Heh. Kidding, I swear.
author: Janna M.

description: If you have the patience to deal with the grumpy workers, then you will probably enjoy the coffee.  Even the ever so common Mocha was full of coffee flavor without being overly sweet or rich.  Sometimes you just don't want rich coffee; you just want coffee as it is.  Really great.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Staff was friendly.

Drinks were priced according to the touristy area, but the coffee wasn't on par with even Starbucks.

To use the bathroom, the cashier has to buzz you in. The bathroom is completely disgusting. Toilet paper is not on the roll, just leaned precariously on top of the handicap rail. There is a window behind the toilet where any junkie can just look in on you. The walls have horrible, amateur graffiti on them and the bathroom smells like pi$$...not pee or a normal bathroom smell...pi$$. Disgusting. 

Instead of demanding that everyone buy something prior to being allowed to use the bathroom, maybe they should spray it down with some Tilex or Clorox!
author: Rosie P.

description:
Quirky and one-of-a-kind cafe indeed.  I would study/hang out there--only if they didn't try to gyp me with the cost of drinks.

We went there for tea after dinner, and the staffer carelessly pressed a bunch of numbers.  We ordered 2 hot drinks (list price ranging $1.95 to $2.50 or so), and the staffer said, "That'd be $7-something" (forgot exact price).  I'm no genius, but 2 drinks that cost no more than $2.50 each does not add up to $7-something.  We paid first but then thought about this and became confused by the whole transaction.  We brought it up to the staffer, who then realized the mistake.  To make the matter more complicated, settling the difference from 'fake' cost to 'real' cost took waay too much time and effort.

Hopefully that was just an one-time situation, but if I were to go there again, I'd make sure they are charging me correctly for the right drinks and for the right prices.
author: Judy C.

description: Found everything I needed here to get done work done, good seating, fast Wi-Fi and quick service. Staff was very friendly, loved the 60s hippie vibe. Food was fresh too!
author: Sophiya P.

description: Coffee to the People has great service and yummy coffee. I had been searching for an establishment that uses hemp milk. Surprisingly, this has been hard to find. Hemp milk cappuccinos are the best!! Come here and try one!
author: Erica F.

description:
Nice cafe with lots of room - from tables to couches - decent amount of outlets and good, free wifi. It's all very Haight Street, from the art on the walls (today it's peace-symbol dream-catchers) to the option of non-dairy hemp milk.

My 'for here' cappuccino was delicious and automatically served in a mug - always a BIG plus in my book. The cookie I had was fresh and tasty. Guess I'll come back to try a bagel or sandwich.

All in all, a good place for tourists and locals alike!
author: Lisa W.

description:
Coffee to the people hasn't changed a bit other than management and the faces of those who work behind the counter. Looks like a the family who bought the place now works here. The reviews people have below are ridiculous, and don't in any way line up with the "liberal, hip" ethos. If you're so hip, so liberal, then widen your perspective and realize that the "polo wearing guy on the other side of the counter" doesn't care that you're a "hippie"  because you're not (I'm guessing someone forgot to check their calendar, that's a term that applies to a certain group circa 1967...Happy New Year it's 2012!!!)

The complaints below are very much in line with the philosophy of about 7 people who live and moan in the neighborhood. Maybe if I put it to you in terms you can understand:

"To everything - turn, turn, turn
There is a season - turn, turn, turn
And a time for every purpose under heaven

A time to build up, a time to break down
A time to dance, a time to mourn
A time to cast away stones
A time to gather stones together

etc. etc."

That means shit changes...including coffee shops. 

p.s. the coffee hasn't changed a bit, and I am a coffee snob born of immigrants from coffee snob country and raised on killer coffee. 

Oh wait, there is one drastic change; I no longer have to share the bathroom with rude, dirty, entitled campers that live on the corner. YAY...everyone wins.
author: Lina B.

description:
It was a beautiful Friday afternoon in sf..  the time was 11:am.
 I had about 30 minutes before a long, back to back meeting filled day.  and wanted a snack.. I entered the coffee shop and placed my order. 

Bacon turkey wrap no onions. I tipped, grabbed a bottle of water and sat down. I waited about 15 minutes for my wrap to find it had onions in it.. I took it back, explained that I requested no onions and that I am in fact allergic to oinions.. The little seemingly well mannered dweeby teenager said no problem and took it back.. I now had 15 minutes to eat and get to my meeting..

AND THEN BY MAGIC..
2 Minutes later.. my wrap appeared.. I suspiciously looked at it and saw that it had an onion hanging out., I opened it up and saw it was still covered in onions.. If your gonna pick em off at least pick em off dammit... I asked for my money back upset that I now had to attend my meeting hungrey.. 

Now before I go further everyone makes mistakes and what not and deserve second chances and all that jazz.. 

BUT they laughed. It wa a joke. I think they were high as kites and that's all good too. I've never been so insulted in my life.. I understand u lil clerks wanna hit the droskies on ur break.. Eyes red and I know the manager smokes too but that's another story.. It all good to get stonec though... 

But don't Phucks wit a black woman and her food.. If I wasn't a block away from one of my worksites that chubby ass cabbage patch lookin skank woulda got the bidness.. Don't let my bun and fake eye glasses fool u.. That just my work look.. And the lil four eyed C3PO looking cashier coulda got  it too.
author: Marcella P.

description:
I live right around the corner from CTTP. I used to go there all the time and would previously have given them a 5 star rating. ...Maybe 4.3771 as the internet cut out with some frequency.

The kids who worked there were cool, they played good music and they crafted decent coffee drinks.  

For whatever reasons the place was having some financial troubles and they changed management.  That's where the good times end.

While the decor has not changed everything else has.  The cool kids all got canned; replaced by the same two people who work there every day, all day. These people have zero personality. One guy in particular really just sucks. Sorry, that's not very nice...but yeah, he sucks. 

I was informed by this person that they no longer honor the 10 purchases gets you one drink of your choice benefit. Now they have a 20-purchase punch card. The guy was quite clear that you can only receive what you typically purchase. And he knows because he is there ALL. THE. TIME.  

The music also sucks now. I think they play radio. What? Lame! 

The other day when I went in with my own mug from home the guy wanted to know if it was a 16 oz because he was trying to figure out how much to charge. Most places appreciate when you bring in your own vessel and give you a little discount.  

It makes me sad. I really liked CTTP before and now I don't at all. Unfortunately the other local cafe that I migrated to burned down last month. Dang.
author: Evan A.

description:
I really want to like this place since it's only a block from my house and is really the only coffee shop in the upper Haight where you can go and do work and chill out. I've given it countless chances to prove me wrong, but everytime I go I walk out unsatisfied. The staff is very unfriendly, and they really dont' care if they forget your order entirely. The place isn't clean - it often smells like the dirty hippies that hang out side the entrance. 

My biggest problem with this place is the unfriendly staff.
author: Adam Z.

description: Really unpretentious vibe. Decent offerings, and the staff are always pleasant and quick. I'm glad I catch my bus just feet from the front door here.
author: S W.

description:
This place is mostly a daytime shelter for the area's homeless and near homeless. The stench of body odor is strong.

Up until about two or three years ago, this was a hip and happening cafe with a countercultural vibe. Then an Asian immigrant family took it over and they had no clue what they were doing. This place lost much of the local regular business, leaving a vacuum for the street people to take it over.

The coffee is pretty bad.

If you take children here, I would suggest that you bring hand sanitizer and keep their hands away from their faces.

The stench is less near the entrance if it is open due to fresher air.

You'll notice higher ratings from tourists. That's because the place still *looks* like a cool cafe. It's a shame they'll never experience what this place once was. :(

Good luck on your visit.
author: John S.

description: I wanted to love the hot chai latte that I ordered, but I just couldn't :( It was way too watered down. I enjoy the relaxed atmosphere of this place, but I'll have to make sure to order something else next time
author: Taylor M.

description:
I literally just went here, and am drinking this "coffee" beverage as I type. Totally disgusting. Hello 95% milk in my double shot iced latte. It tastes like milk. If I wanted milk I'd buy milk, not a $3.50 iced latte.

As soon as my husband and I walked in.. they were rude. Said hi to the woman behind the counter, she didn't say hi back.. just gave us both dirty looks. As I was ordering our drinks, my husband went to the bathroom and the young man at the register LEANED OVER the counter to watch him to the bathroom. I'm not sure if he was checking him out or thinking he was going to steal something.. regardless it was RUDE. 

If you don't look like a college bookworm, and maybe want some coffee... DON'T GO HERE. They'll treat you like a leper.. and THEY CAN'T MAKE COFFEE AT ALL. 


The most unfortunate part of this is that I've been going to this place since I was a teenager! Never have I felt this mistreated, and never has the coffee been so disgusting.

BUMMER.
author: Kat S.

description:
I was desperately in need of a caffeine fix while shopping with friends on Haight, and stumbled upon this little gem. The interior is very open - there was a lot of sunlight coming in through the window, and there are cute dream catchers hanging all over the walls. 

I saw that they had just added hemp milk to the menu, and when I inquired about it (I've never had it before) the woman and man working there offered me a sample right away - I didn't even have to ask! It was delicious - sweeter than I expected, and the hemp milk latte I ended up ordering was great. But, hemp milk contains no THC. Aw.

Friendly service, chill atmosphere, supporting local business - will be back for sure next time I'm on Haight!
author: Michele L.

description: I can always count on tasty coffee and a clean restroom when visiting the Haight District. Whether it be on a photo shoot or just visiting. Fabulous white mochas!
author: Rebecca P.

description:
I live near this place, and when I first moved here (this past May) it was a great place to grab some pastries and coffee! I even asked one of the girls working the register (who no longer works there) if they were hiring, and she told me to check back later as they had recently switched management.

Since then, any of the nice kids who had worked there no longer do, and it's generally an unfriendly guy at the register.

Their coffee is still good for drip coffee (I get the dark roast) but the almond croissant I used to enjoy there has been stale the past two times I've ordered it, which is a total disappointment. 

It's sad, it's definitely a cool spot to hang out but I think the new management has made some bad moves.
author: Meg L.

description:
"Coffee to the People" used to be my absolutely favorite coffee shop on Haight.. But since they changed owners, all went down the hill, especially -the COFFEE. Now they serve "brown water" and charge you two bux for it! it's absolutely disgusting! it doesn't even smell like coffee anymore. I stopped going there since they fired all the original staff, and today as my first time in something like... forever. NEVER AGAIN !!

seriously, don't do it! go block and a half up Haight to "Haight Street Market" !!
author: Anat K.

description: I love the atmosphere here!  It feels just like my favourite coffee shop in Tucson.  I really wished I could have spent a whole day there, just sipping tea and reading my book, but alas, I was in San Francisco to see every nook and cranny of the city, so I didn't have time to dilly-dally.  I'm very glad I got to stop by a few mornings.  Great, cute place.
author: Aishan S.

description:
So, management here changed at some point and everything sucks more than it used to. I've seen the miserly guy behind the counter (presumably the new owner) blatantly lie to the homeless people who want to use the bathroom and give dirty looks to people who aren't dressed like he is (think polo shirts). In general, the employees/ owners seem to really dislike the population of people who hang out around the upper Haight St area, leaving me to wonder why they thought purchasing this previously liberal/hippie cafe was a good idea. This is speculation, but I wonder if they bother following the composting/ recycling labels the previous owners put up. 

I used to like coming here to study, but watching the owners treat customers so poorly is just too upsetting to watch. Despite being very anti-chain businesses, I would honestly rather go to a Starbucks to study late than to CTTP with the new owners.
author: Clarissa D.

description:
This place is great...
I love to go and just relax and have a nice coffee and a bagel for breakfast.
The price is good and there is always where to sit.
I also like the design there, its a nice big space that really feel like Haight st.
Also they have instruction about recycling the cups etc.
author: dor w.

description: Chill spot with yummy looking food $$ priced -- yummy fresh juice without added sugars and powders! Great for get together with friends.
author: Alissa L.

description:
I never Yelp but I had to take the time and actually make an effort to explain how RUDE and bitchy one staff member was to me while I was in this coffee shop. First, my friend asked if there was a key for the restroom and she snapped back asking if she was going to buy anything from them first. My friend explained that she wanted to use the restroom before ordering her coffee. Granted, it is the Haight and there are a lot of people who try to use restrooms in establishments with out purchasing something but she was very rude to her and she didn't have to give her attitude. 

I was also taking photos of friends and documenting our day together and I only took a few photos and she rudely explained to me about not asking permission to take photos and how I can get sued for taking photos in a establishment with out asking permission. I back fired with being very apologetic and told her I didn't know they were so strict and then she rolled her eyes at me and said 'that she would let me go this time"...seriously?! Really?! What are you, Starbucks?! Be professional, explain things calmly and don't make a scene and approach people with a matter of respect. It's not like I was publishing these photos, working for an ad agency, I was taking photos of my friends who were from out of town! 

On the way out another customer stopped me and told me that she always has an attitude problem. Why in the hell would you staff people like this?! Customer service is key to any business and my first experience, first impression, first cup of coffee and guarantee my last.
author: annamarie c.

description:
I love this place because (on a different note) I found street parking right in front of Coffee to the People. 
This place is super awesome! I want to go back! Take me back! The boyfriend took me here to get some ice beverage on a hot day. 
I ordered an Iced Lemonade Tea - whimmpy I know, but I had coffee already. The boyfriend had an Iced Coffee. He said it was awesome. The Iced Lemonade Tea was really good even though it was just an Iced Tea and Lemonade. 

I want to come here and write my future novel.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
It seems a lot of people are bitter about the ownership change.  I think it's more about personal feelings than about the coffee.  (Hey, maybe direct some of that bitterness to the old owners who clearly weren't all that into peace, love, and happiness if they were willing to sell out and rake in a lot of cold hard cash.)

I say this because I was going to this place for a solid year before ownership changed.  Yeah, there were some pretty awesome and nice people who used to work there.  To be fair, there were also a couple pretty heinous people who were pretty mean to the homeless folks/kids hanging out in the street outside.  (One girl yelled at them in front of everyone in the store.)

All that is to say, the biggest change I've noticed is that they use different cardboard cup-holder thingies, now.  Which is a little sad b/c the old ones with the store's logo were neat.  The walls still have local art rotating in and out, there's still a mix of students, locals, hippies, and preppier folks inside.  I haven't noticed any real change in the quality of the coffee--and I'm a coffee snob.  

The new folks are pretty nice.  Particularly two of the ladies working there.  One guy is a little quieter, but I certainly don't think he's mean.

...And I haven't seen them hassling anyone about using the bathroom.  I have seen them get a little frustrated when an older customer kept running to the bathroom every 10 minutes and was yelling that the door wasn't buzzed open fast enough...but everyone's human, and they certainly weren't keeping him from using the bathroom.

All in all, this place is solid for a cup of coffee.  Much better than the people's cafe on Haight (read:  MUCH faster service and a more neighborhood vibe).  Also, when I switched to decaf, the folks at Coffee to the People noticed and started brewing fresh decaf to have on hand.  AND, the flavor of the decaf is pretty good.  I'm a fan.


UPDATE:  about the 10-purchase card.  They still honor it.  I've gotten about 4 free coffees since the new owners started.  Yeah, the card has 20 boxes on it now.  They're saving paper.  You still get a free drink after 10 purchases, they just draw a line through the one row of boxes and start stamping the next row.  ...And my last free drink was definitely a large mocha when my usual is a medium drip.
author: Lauren C.

description:
We only went to this place since it was the starting location for the Haunted Haight Ghost Tour.  We arrived early so we went in for some water and hot chocolate.  For starters, the hot chocolate was good.  We did have an interesting experience there.  According to the hours, the place was supposed to close at 8.  We were there at 630.  When we asked if it was open, we got "if we were closed there wouldn't be people in here."  This went on as she was putting chairs on tables and mopping up.  Looked like closing to us.  After that encounter, she ran to the ordering station to take our order.  This time she was super friendly and asking us questions about our relationship, etc.  It was like 2 different people.  We didn't really know what to think about this and just chalked it up to an interesting experience.  

Overall not a bad place.  The shop itself was interesting.  The product was good, just the help was a little off.
author: Joel G.

description: Such a nice coffee shop to relax at.  The coffees are great and made with care and full of flavor.  This isn't one of the nescient, inferior coffee shops that scam us from time to time.  Coffee to the People is aptly named and provides 100% satisfaction in customer service, quality, and atmosphere.  Highly recommended for anyone who wants to have a pleasant place to sit down and relax while enjoying Haight-Ashbury district.
author: Misty H.

description:
Decent coffee, friendly baristas, chill music, happy vibe.

Small lattes come with a single shot - I'm definitely glad I got an extra one. Delicious with the double, but in general single-shot lattes just don't cut it for me.

Americano was pretty delish - strong and bold.

Interested in the insane special drink with four shots of espresso in coffee - sounds either like heaven or my worst nightmare. Probably the latter.

Arcade fire on the playlist, a nice little library + board game collection, spacious digs with a mix of comfy couches or tables, free wifi that was dependable the whole time I used it, open fairly late.

Kinda reminds me of what I miss about the coffee shops in the midwest.

Credit cards accepted on purchases over $5, with a fiddy cent surcharge.
author: Monica C.

description: Nice interior, nice, simple cafe menu. I'd go here again.
author: Denise C.

description: The drinks aren't very good here-- my iced tea was very watery and my friend wasn't a fan of her coffee either. The staff was not very friendly or welcoming either. You're better off going around the corner to People's Cafe instead where they've got good coffee and more food choices.
author: Sasha B.

description:
This is a cute, homely kind of place -- like the kind that you'd want to kick back and relax in. Or grab a cup of coffee to go (which I've had to do on more than one occasion). Anyhow, the coffee is delicious here but what I really love is that banana mocha blended drink. Very tasty -- not too heavy on the mocha with a good hint of banana but still tastes like a coffee based drink. 

I didn't have anything to eat although the pastries do look scrumptious so perhaps another time I will finally indulge.
author: Shauna S.

description:
- Friendly service - I always get my medium coffee to-go with a smile. (+1)
- Great location - It is right next to where I catch the bus. (+1)
- Fairly cheap coffee - $1.95 for a medium.  Not bad for San Francisco. (+1)
- Mediocre coffee - The coffee is pretty weak and bitter.  (-1)
- Nice working space - Free Wi-Fi.  Lots of tables and outlets. (+1)

= +3.  Meh, A-OK.
author: Evelyn L.

description: Fun drinks, I bought a Macha Mocha!  20oz for 4 bucks not bad!!
author: Thomas C.

description:
First, this place is REALLY overpriced. $5 for a bagel with cream cheese? WTF? I waited forever for our order... egg & cheese croissant (American cheese, microwaved eggs... ugh) and the aforementioned bagel with cream cheese. 

Then, the bagel wasn't even toasted? Siiiigh.

This place gets 2 stars instead of 1 for atmosphere; the vintage political buttons on the table tops are pretty interesting to look at. Otherwise... this place is not all that.
author: Carrie G.

description:
I'm sitting in the place right now using their internet waiting for a new toy to come out online at 7:00PM. Because the internet is free and fast, this place gets a good rating.

On top of the free internet, they are pretty nice about using the bathroom as long as you don't look like a bum I guess. The restroom sign does say "only for customers" but they are reasonable folks.

I haven't really ordered anything here but some lemonade iced-tea which was pretty decent. The other stuff looks good and there's lots of food items which look almost appetizing. Just your basic coffee spot pastries I guess.

Some more points:
The place is pretty artsy, good vibe to chill in. Painting, photography, and bumper stickers fill the walls.
There's couches and plenty of tables, won't be too hard to find a spot to sit.
If you're lucky, you can sit near the wall to get a power outlet.
Spacious place with a high ceiling, well ventilated.
Right off Haight street where there's some pretty cool shops and restaurants.

I really can't find any drawbacks about this place. Since I'm not a big coffee buff I can't really speak on that. But otherwise, everything else is great. Hell yes to the free & fast wifi.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I really like how they have couches around table.

It's really comfy, and I could stay there for hours:)

The place is bright cuz it gets the light from ceiling window:)

There are lots of books on the shelve if you are ever bored.

They have pretty good choices for drinks:)

Lovely.
author: Kate S.

description:
I'd never been here under the previous regime ("Coffee to the People" + "regime" get it?)

The coffee isn't bad, it's definitely not worth a special trip.  Staff is pretty quiet, not a lot of personality going on there, and the food is on the pricey side.

Typically when I'm there, it's with a friend and we're trying to get some work done. They have Wi-Fi which is worth a star.    

I've seen the homeless people inside the shop get a little aggressive when people sit at tables too close to them ("My friend's on his way here, and that's his seat.")

If I'm going strictly for coffee, I'd grab some from Haight-Street Market  up the street or head to the Peet's on Broderick up the street.
author: Michael M.

description:
British Rob is going to have an aneurysm after reading this.   A four star review this weekend followed by a FIVE.

What can I say, for me this place was great.  It's no Fluid Coffee Bar in Denver but other than FCB what is?

Walking in the front door I was immediately lightened by the seating.  Along with the usual small caffe tables and chairs they have 3 sections with comfy sofas around coffee tables.

They actually know how to handle orders here.  Someone on the cash register taking orders and someone else actually filling orders.  Instead of the pre Henry Ford idiocy that most of the shops around here adhere to.

They had loose leaf tea which was great but their steeping process lacks a little.  I was briefly disappointed when the girl making my tea was going to put it in a paper cup but the cashier told corrected her and told her it was for here.  Which garnered me a nice ceramic mug.  Unfortunately they ruined that with a muslin tea bag for the leaves and not timing it or informing me that I should steep the tea for n minutes.  Fortuitously there is an app for that.  The  loose leaf tea was great and they offer it by the pot which I spotted behind the counter and it has a real diffuser which I will be taking advantage of next time I order.  $5 for a pot of tea though, so not cheap but cheaper then The Summit.

If it were to lose a star for anything it would be its location.  The Haight is cool but a little louse'y with tourists and hippies.  If throngs of people aren't your thing this might not be the best place to caffeinate. 

I think this place is great and will be back for certain.
author: Max Jonathan S.

description:
Staff: "What would you like on that breakfast sandwich?"
Customer: "Whatever you want."
Staff: "Yes!  Sandwich creativity.  Unrestricted freedom!"

Slightly mixed feelings on this place, but overall have to give it a positive review.  First off, the coffee is outstanding.  I have Emma's and Central both within a block of my place, yet a trudge up Masonic twice a week for the White Mocoa here, so I think that tells you something.  I also am addicted to their vegan donuts.  These things are my kyrptonite, although at $2 each I manage to keep the count down.  

The only problem, as with many places on Haight, is the riff-raff.  A few days ago I overhear a convo between the staff that a junkie had come back in the store in the afternoon, fretting that he left needles in the bathroom that morning.  Jesus Christ - do NOT use the bathroom here.  Hit up Magnolia instead!
author: John H.

description: Relaxed atmosphere from couches in the well lite "library nook" to small tables for wifi-ing or just visiting (do people really do that anymore?) This place has good yummy drinks and treats to enjoy. I like the Unique Knots designs on the walls offered for sale from the artist and just the basic vibes all around. I'm giving it a nice big thumbs up.
author: Royce B.

description:
The new owners are No Good.

When they got the place, they eliminated everyone's benefits, slashed wages, and then did the classic "brain-drain and fire" move. All the cool people were suddenly gone, along with the eclectic music and fun atmosphere.
